Parallel and distributed algorithms are used to solve large, computationally intensive problems in science and engineering. We work on the interface between discrete mathematics, theoretical computer science, and parallel aspects of computing. We combine various techniques from these fields to design efficient solutions for problems such as information dissemination, distributed communication, network exploration, load balancing, and graph models for large real world networks. Teaching In teaching, we cover the basic course for algorithms and data structures for 1st year students, as well as more advanced courses on algorithms for 3rd year bachelor and master students. In addition, we run basic courses in theoretical computer science. We also offer a number of seminars and projects related to parallel and distributed algorithms.
